text.text: The WonderSwan released in Japan in March 1999, is a portable 16-bit video game console created by Bandai. It is a monochrome console that sells well in Japan despite the release a year earlier of the Game Boy Color thanks to its small size and its great autonomy of 30 hours. With a NEC 3 Mhz processor, 16 KB of RAM, a 224x144 pixel display in 8 levels of gray and a stereo sound, it can be played vertically and horizontally. Some games use it in theyâ€™re level design. It has a fairly large game library with many titles based on animated, or from Bandai, Square and Capcom.
